description:
This adds the discrete colormaps from colorbrewer. Matplotlib already has smooth versions of these colormaps (they are the ones that start with capital letters), but I've found that discrete colormaps can be useful for conveying actual values in images/phase plots. Another nice thing is that these can be used to make colorblind/printer/greyscale-friendly plots.  If brewer2mpl is not found, a runtime error is raised informing the user to install it. 

Docs have been updated, as well as removing a note that not all matplotlib colormaps are available in the image_writer, since we enabled all of these in a prior change.
title: Add colorbrewer2 colormaps via (optional) brewer2mpl

content.raw:
I think this is true, at least I can do the following:

```
#!python

ds = yt.load('DD0043/data0043')
sl = yt.SlicePlot(ds, 0, 'x-velocity')
sl.set_log('all', False)
sl.set_cmap('all', ('RdBu','Diverging',8))
sl.save()
sl.set_cmap('all', 'algae')
sl.save()
sl.set_cmap('all', 'PRISM_r')
sl.save()
sl.set_cmap('all', 'Spectral')
sl.save()
```
content.html:

sl.save()
sl.set_cmap('all', 'algae')
sl.save()
sl.set_cmap('all', 'PRISM_r')
sl.save()
sl.set_cmap('all', 'Spectral')
sl.save()

content.raw: OK.  Sounds fair.  I thought that when I wrote the generation stuff, it just sampled all of the cmaps available, but perhaps something new has to be done to incorporate the brewer2mpl cmaps too, and to make sure it's installed on the doc build machine.  Are you willing to start a PR on that after this goes in? Or should we just write it up as an issue to be dealt with in the future?

content.raw:
I pushed a hotfix for this in ecd32f6.

This raises an issue - we use the `cmap_name` a bunch of other places in the code - should we unify the names of all of these keyword arguments? `cmap_name` is more descriptive but I don't want to break user scripts.
content.html:
I pushed a hotfix for this in ecd32f6.

This raises an issue - we use the cmap_name a bunch of other places in the code - should we unify the names of all of these keyword arguments? cmap_name is more descriptive but I don't want to break user scripts.

content.raw: That's a hard one.  Ideally we would've made the API switch in the 2.x to 3.0 transition, but now I'm not sure.  This will definitely break people's code if we do this.  Perhaps we should just have an arg for cmap_name and a kwarg for cmap that catches it and remains backwards compatible?
content.html: That's a hard one. Ideally we would've made the API switch in the 2.x to 3.0 transition, but now I'm not sure. This will definitely break people's code if we do this. Perhaps we should just have an arg for cmap_name and a kwarg for cmap that catches it and remains backwards compatible?
